Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
There is a post about BIP39 seed phrase entropy that was once shared with me.   The explanation in it was showing how leaking the position of word reduces the entropy greatly.

Are you able to reshare the link if you are familiar with my request, jl or community?
Cheers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just leaking the word, discloses the exact bits that must be in the privkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: our method hashes the entire seed, so even if a word is leaked, it wont give much advantage in decoding privkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the word and position is known, that is even worse with bip39 as that directly reduces the entropy bits

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i dont remember any formal post, it was just something i wrote on discord

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @Mylo https://jmcintyre.net/?p=180

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Legend, thanks poly

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: And jl - yeah I was explaining the 256bit hashed seed of iguana to a cpl ppl

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: kmd is not the country code for Indonesia ,  the closest claimant to the gTLD is a small town.  We have a strong claim because of our ticker, name and community size .    If someone wants to try and do a non-ICANN domain name feel free to,  just be aware of the benefits and drawbacks

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @jl777c  any chance of Ramchains making a reappearance ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what aspect of it?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Fast syncing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: fast syncing is definitely possible, even without the highly encoded ramchain data structures

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but a much more efficient way would be to automatically validate a bootstrap using nspv

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and having incremental bootstraps

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Yes that does seem better as all it has to do is validate notarizations ,  didn’t think of nSPV being applied to bootstraps before

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just need to nSPV validate a tx in the latest bootstrap height at notarization. then the entire bootstrap is validated

Author: steinsg8#0288
Content: Honest question that perhaps might make some people angry. How is it possible to justify the current value of the top 100 coins. Coins with 10-50k in transactions per a day are valued at over 100 mill. Seem like an illusion. Take komodo for example, what can justify the price? Technology? It's all open, can't someone take it? The team? You guys are amazing but 20 mill can prob make a great team. Utilization? There is not much use that would require coins to be purchased. Speculation? Of what exactly? There are 1000 coins competing to do nearly the same things. Anyone have an answer? I feel crypto will go to 80% under current prices in 1 year.

And that value will start moving into the more established coins. We're past the phase where any coin with a roadmap can establish funding. They'll need something tangible. Just my thoughts
